channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023100472
item.description:
Report E-2023100472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGR experienced a UN1814 ConvoClean Forte release from a 2.5-gallon poly jug. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.25-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to improper handling. Absorbents were deployed by XPO terminal personnel and worked into the impacted area by contractors. The impacted absorbents and damaged jug were then containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100573
item.description:
Report E-2023100573

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-24
  • City: DETROIT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 24, 2023 at 20:37 Transportation personnel in the Conrail Livernois Terminal reported that ,GATX 2013 a loaded tank car of FLUOROSILICIC ACID leaking from top of the tank car upon movement. Additionally, during routine switching operations a Conrail Conductor was splashed with acid from the improperly secured tank car. The Conductor was immediately brought in to remove affected clothing and shower of any impacted skin. No reportable injury was encountered as the Conductors and Terminal Supervisions actions removed all material before any health effects took place. The car was isolated and the shipper/consignee PVS was notified directly via phone. Enviroserve, an approved Conrail Contractor was notified to respond, inspect and secure the tank car. Enviroserve personnel, investigated the leak and found the source of the leak to be from the rupture disk assembly. Upon further inspection it was found that the inspection cap was hanging off the housing and no rupture disk was in place beneath the assembly. Additionally, there was no required surge protection on the rupture disk assembly. Enviroserve placed the appropriate rupture disk and resecured the assembly. The tank car was then held until the proper surge protection device could be placed in the assembly. Conrail and Enviroserve worked with the car owner and Steve Kuz, Alltrantec 519-718-8377 to secure the proper service equipment. On October 4, 2023 the new surge protection device was installed on the tank car and it was released back into transportation. Cause Code: 437 5 x ( 5 + 5 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 2 ) = 200

Report X-2023090975

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking hazmat package was found on delivery truck. Once damage was discovered, the package was taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: 1 2.5L bottle was shattered. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once damage was discovered, the package was taken to QA for inspection.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and leaking, Proper PPE was used to remove the package from the area and placed into a hazmat bin. Upon inspection we found that one bottle had a loose cap and was leaking. DescribePack: one bottle had a loose cap and was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to remove the package from the area and placed into a hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023090964
item.description:
Report X-2023090964

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: SALINE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to inspect a leaking hazmat package that was sent down the van line sideways. Upon further inspection, it was found that the cap had come loose on one of the bottles of degreaser, causing the contents to leak out. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was called to inspect and retrieve the package when damage was discovered.
